title: What can I do if my phone runs out of power quickly?
answer:
l   Turn on power saving mode. Go to **Settings**, touch **Power saving**, and select **Smart** or **Ultra**, or under **Details**, turn off background power-intensive applications.

![](http://consumer.huawei.com/support/servlet/imageServlet?dlType=SupportImage&imagePath=/20141202182104431001.jpg)![](http://consumer.huawei.com/support/servlet/imageServlet?dlType=SupportImage&imagePath=/20141202182104546002.jpg)![](http://consumer.huawei.com/support/servlet/imageServlet?dlType=SupportImage&imagePath=/20141202182104540003.jpg)

l   Close applications not in use.

l   Turn off the screen when your phone is not in use.

l   Reduce the screen timeout period.

l   Reduce the screen brightness.

l   Reduce the volume.

l   Turn off your data service, Bluetooth, Wi-Fi, or GPS when you do not need them.

l   Turn off your 4G network when you do not need it or the network is not available.

If your phone's standby time becomes significantly shorter than usual, contact Huawei technical support or take your phone to an authorized Huawei service center.

Huawei releases updates at its official website from time to time. For better user experience, use the online update feature to update your phone.
